intro: Bladhia elliptica, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant found in freshwater habitats. It is characterized by its slender, elliptical leaves and small, bladder-like structures that trap small aquatic organisms. The plant is a member of the Lentibulariaceae family, known for its carnivorous traits. It typically grows in shallow, still waters and is often found in ponds and marshes. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
